industry_definition: Establishments primarily engaged in manufacturing automotive transmissions and parts, including auxiliary transmission parts, clutches, torque converters, valve bodies and other transmission rebuilding parts.
key_trends: The pandemic caused the whole auto sector to struggle. Limited economic activity and the reduced need for transportation caused demand for new cars to plummet.
Technological improvements will separate transmission manufacturers. The push to improve fuel efficiency and integrate with EVs will define the auto sector moving forward.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Original equipment manufacturers that purchase complete drivetrains for new vehicle production.
Repair shops, dealerships and individuals purchasing transmission components for repairs.
Federal, state and local government vehicle fleets requiring transmission maintenance and repairs.

products_and_services.product_description: Transmissions connect the engine to the drivetrain and control gear ratios. Automatic transmissions are most popular in the US.
Axles connect parallel wheels and smooth the ride. Transaxles integrate transmission and axle functions.
Differentials, drive shafts and other parts that transfer power from the engine to the wheels.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Substantial revenue is generated from selling complete drivetrains to OEMs for new cars.
The aftermarket sells to repair shops, individuals and dealerships for repair purposes.
The US government maintains a vast fleet of vehicles that endure heavy use and require constant maintenance.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Low-cost alternatives from Mexico and foreign automakers' US operations push automakers to import transmissions.
An appreciating US dollar makes imports more appealing while raising the cost of exports for foreign buyers.
The pandemic disrupted international trade, causing exports to fall behind as other countries reopened manufacturing faster than the US.

business_locations.location_description: Michigan is a key location for the automobile transmission manufacturing industry.
California accounts for a smaller share of the industry.
Indiana is another major hub for the industry.
Ohio accounts for a share of industry revenue.
North Carolina represents a share of revenue in the industry.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The automobile transmission manufacturing industry is subject to strict regulations.
Significant start-up costs for automobile transmission manufacturers are necessary.
It is difficult for new entrants to differentiate themselves from established manufacturers.
